articles.Title: Over 3.1 million fake "stars" on GitHub projects used to boost rankings
articles.Summary: GitHub has a problem with inauthentic "stars" used to artificially inflate the popularity of scam and malware distribution repositories. The problem has been documented previously, like last summer when Check Point uncovered a malware delivery service named the 'Stargazers Ghost Network'

articles.Title: Massive healthcare breaches prompt US cybersecurity rules overhaul
articles.Summary: The U.S. Department of Health and Human Services has proposed updates to the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act of 1996 (HIPAA) These stricter cybersecurity rules are expected to be published as a final rule within 60 days. They would require healthcare organizations to encrypt protected health information (PHI)

articles.Title: US Treasury Department breached through remote support platform
articles.Summary: Chinese state-sponsored threat actors hacked the U.S. Treasury Department after breaching a remote support platform used by the federal agency. The Treasury Department warned lawmakers it was first notified of the breach on December 8th by its vendor BeyondTrust. BeyondTrust is a privileged access management company that also offers a Remote Support SaaS platform that can be used to access computers remotely.

articles.Title: Hackers exploit Four-Faith router flaw to open reverse shells
articles.Summary: VulnCheck says hackers can gain access to those devices because many are configured with default credentials, which are easy to brute force. The attack begins with the transmission of a specially crafted shell message. VulnCheck notified Four-Faith and its customers about this issue on December 20, 2024.

articles.Title: Malware botnets exploit outdated D-Link routers in recent attacks
articles.Summary: Two botnets tracked as ‘Ficora’ and ‘Capsaicin’ have recorded increased activity in targeting D-Link routers that have reached end of life or are running outdated firmware versions. The botnets can steal data and execute shell scripts. Ficora has a widespread geographic distribution with some focus on Japan and the United States. Capsaicin appears to be targeting mostly devices in East Asian countries.

articles.Title: Hackers steal ZAGG customers' credit cards in third-party breach
articles.Summary: ZAGG Inc. is informing customers that their credit card data has been exposed to unauthorized individuals. Hackers compromised a third-party application provided by the company's e-commerce provider, BigCommerce. ZAGG is a consumer electronics accessories maker known for its mobile accessories.

articles.Title: Customer data from 800,000 electric cars and owners exposed online
articles.Summary: Volkswagen’s automotive software company, Cariad, exposed data collected from around 800,000 electric cars. The info could be linked to drivers’ names and reveal precise vehicle locations. The exposed databases include details for VW, Seat, Audi, and Skoda vehicles.

articles.Title: Hackers exploit DoS flaw to disable Palo Alto Networks firewalls
articles.Summary: Palo Alto Networks is warning that hackers are exploiting the CVE-2024-3393 denial of service vulnerability to disable firewall protections. Leveraging the security issue repeatedly, however, causes the device to enter maintenance mode and manual intervention is required to restore it to normal operations.

articles.Title: Vulnerable Moxa devices expose industrial networks to attacks
articles.Summary: Industrial networking and communications provider Moxa is warning of a high-severity and a critical vulnerability. The two seurity issues allow remote attackers to get root privileges on vulnerable devices. The vulnerabilities impact various models of its cellular routers, secure routers and network security appliances.

articles.Title: Eagerbee backdoor deployed against Middle Eastern govt orgs, ISPs
articles.Summary: New variants of the Eagerbee malware framework are being deployed against government organizations and internet service providers in the Middle East. Previously, the malware was seen in attacks conducted by Chinese state-backed threat actors who Sophos tracked as 'Crimson Palace' According to a new report by Kaspersky researchers, there's a potential connection to a threat group they call 'CoughingDown'

articles.Title: Windows 10 users urged to upgrade to avoid "security fiasco"
articles.Summary: Windows 10 will no longer receive free security updates for the operating system on October 14, 2025. This means that Windows 10 users will be at risk of any new vulnerabilities that are discovered. According to ESET, approximately 32 million cities are currently running Windows 10.

articles.Title: Cryptocurrency wallet drainers stole $494 million in 2024
articles.Summary: The data comes from web3 anti-scam platform 'Scam Sniffer,' which has been tracking wallet drainer activity for a while now. Wallet drainers are phishing tools specifically designed to steal cryptocurrency or other digital assets from users' wallets, often deployed on fake or compromised websites.

articles.Title: Nuclei flaw lets malicious templates bypass signature verification
articles.Summary: Nuclei is a popular open-source vulnerability scanner created by ProjectDiscovery. The project utilizes a template-based scanning system of over 10,000 YAML templates. A new Nuclei vulnerability tracked as CVE-2024-43405 was discovered by researchers at Wi.

articles.Title: New FireScam Android data-theft malware poses as Telegram Premium app
articles.Summary: A new Android malware named ‘FireScam’ is being distributed as a premium version of the Telegram app via phishing websites on GitHub that mimick the RuStore. RuStore launched in May 2022 by the Russian internet group VK (VKontakte) as an alternative to Google Play and Apple’s App Store.

articles.Title: Bad Tenable plugin updates take down Nessus agents worldwide
articles.Summary: Nessus vulnerability scanner agents went offline on December 31st due to buggy differential plugin updates. Tenable has since pulled the bad versions and released Nessus Agent version 10.8.2 to fix the issue. The company says they plan to resume the plugin feed by the end of the day to allow plugin downloads again.

articles.Title: US sanctions Chinese company linked to Flax Typhoon hackers
articles.Summary: The U.S. Treasury Department has sanctioned Beijing-based cybersecurity company Integrity Tech for its involvement in cyberattacks attributed to the Chinese state-sponsored Flax Typhoon hacking group. The company's infrastructure was used to launch attacks targeting networks of victims in Europe and the United States for over a year.

articles.Title: Malicious npm packages target Ethereum developers' private keys
articles.Summary: 20 malicious packages impersonating the Hardhat development environment used by Ethereum developers are targeting private keys and other sensitive data. Collectively, the malicious packages have recorded more than one thousand downloads, researchers say. Hardhat is a widely used Ethereum development environment maintained by the Nomic Foundation.

articles.Title: Apple offers $95 million in Siri privacy violation settlement
articles.Summary: Apple agrees to pay $95 million to settle a class action lawsuit in the U.S. The lawsuit alleges that the audio data was disclosed without users' consent to a network of third-party marketers and advertisers. Users complained of being targeted with advertisements for products concerning sensitive and very specific matters discussed in private conversations.

articles.Title: French govt contractor Atos denies Space Bears ransomware attack claims
articles.Summary: French tech giant Atos has denied claims made by the Space Bears gang that they compromised one of its databases. Atos, which has approximately 82,000 employees and an annual revenue of around €10 billion, describes itself as Europe's leading cybersecurity, cloud, and high-performance computing company.

articles.Title: Ransomware gang leaks data stolen in Rhode Island's RIBridges Breach
articles.Summary: Rhode Island's "RIBridges" social services platform was the target of an attack. RIBridges is an integrated eligibility system (IES) used by the state to manage and deliver social assistance programs. Last week, the Brain Cipher ransomware gang began to leak documents stolen in the attack.

articles.Title: New DoubleClickjacking attack exploits double-clicks to hijack accounts
articles.Summary: DoubleClickjacking lets attackers trick users into authorizing sensitive actions using double-clicks. Clickjacking is when threat actors create malicious web pages that trick visitors into clicking on hidden or disguised webpage elements. The attacks work by overlaying a legitimate webpage in a hidden iframe over a web page created by the attackers.

articles.Title: Over 3 million mail servers without encryption exposed to sniffing attacks
articles.Summary: IMAP and POP3 are two methods for accessing email on mail servers. IMAP is recommended for checking emails from multiple devices, such as phones and laptops. POP3 downloads emails from the server, making them accessible only from the device where they were downloaded.

articles.Title: The biggest cybersecurity and cyberattack stories of 2024
articles.Summary: 2014 was a big year for cybersecurity, with significant cyberattacks, data breaches, new threat groups emerging, and, of course, zero-day vulnerabilities. Some stories, though, were more impactful or popular with our 31 million readers than others. Below are fourteen of what BleepingComputer believes are the most impactful cybersecurity stories of 2024.

articles.Title: New details reveal how hackers hijacked 35 Google Chrome extensions
articles.Summary: New details have emerged about a phishing campaign targeting Chrome browser extension developers that led to the compromise of at least thirty-five extensions. Initial reports focused on Cyberhaven's security-focused extension, subsequent investigations revealed that the same code had been injected into at least 35 extensions collectively used by roughly 2,600,000 people.

articles.Title: European Space Agency's official store hacked to steal payment cards
articles.Summary: The European Space Agency's official web shop was hacked as it started to load a piece of JavaScript code that generates a fake Stripe payment page at checkout. The malicious script appeared on the agency’s site yesterday and collected customer information, including payment card data.

articles.Title: FBI links North Korean hackers to $308 million crypto heist
articles.Summary: North Korean hacker group ‘TraderTraitor’ stole $308 million worth of cryptocurrency in the attack on the Japanese exchange DMM Bitcoin in May. In a short post, the FBI attributed the attack to the state-affiliated threat actor TraderTraitor. The crypto heist occurred in May 2024 and forced the platform to restrict account registration, cryptocurrency withdrawals, and trading until the completion of the investigations.

articles.Title: Clop ransomware is now extorting 66 Cleo data-theft victims
articles.Summary: Clop ransomware gang started to extort victims of its Cleo data theft attacks. The cybercriminals announced that they are contacting those companies directly to provide links to a secure chat channel. If these companies continue to ignore, Clop threatens to disclose their full name in 48 hours.

articles.Title: Adobe warns of critical ColdFusion bug with PoC exploit code
articles.Summary: Adobe has released out-of-band updates to address a critical ColdFusion vulnerability. The company says the flaw (tracked as CVE-2024-53961) is caused by a path traversal weakness. It can enable attackers to read arbitrary files on vulnerable servers.

articles.Title: FTC orders Marriott and Starwood to implement strict data security
articles.Summary: The Federal Trade Commission (FTC) has ordered Marriott International and Starwood Hotels to define and implement a robust customer data security scheme. After acquiring Starwood in 2016 and failing to implement "reasonable data security," Marriott International suffered three major data breaches.

articles.Title: Premium WPLMS WordPress plugins address seven critical flaws
articles.Summary: Two WordPress plugins required by the premium WordPress WPLMS theme are vulnerable to more than a dozen critical severity vulnerabilities. The bugs could enable a remote, unauthenticated attacker to upload arbitrary files to the server, execute code, escalate privileges to administrator level, and perform SQL injections. Patchstack vulnerability researchers found a total of 18 security issues.

articles.Title: Cybersecurity firm's Chrome extension hijacked to steal users' data
articles.Summary: Cyberhaven, a data loss prevention company, alerted its customers of a breach on December 24. Among Cyberhaven's customers are Snowflake, Motorola, Canon, Reddit, AmeriHealth, Cooley, IVP, Navan, DBS, Upstart.

articles.Title: Apache warns of critical flaws in MINA, HugeGraph, Traffic Control
articles.Summary: The Apache Software Foundation has released security updates to address three severe problems that affect MINA, HugeGraph-Server, and Traffic Control products. The vulnerabilities were patched in new software versions released between December 23 and 25. However, the holiday period may lead to a slower patching rate and increased risk of exploitation.

articles.Title: New 'OtterCookie' malware used to backdoor devs in fake job offers
articles.Summary: North Korean threat actors are using new malware called OtterCookie in the Contagious Interview campaign. The campaign targets software developers with fake job offers to deliver malware such as BeaverTail and InvisibleFerret. NTT Security Japan notes that the new piece of malware was likely introduced in September and with a new variant appearing in the wild in November. Just like in the attacks documented by Palo Alto Networks' Unit42 researchers, the loader fetches JSON data and executes the ‘cookie’ property as JavaScript code.

articles.Title: New botnet exploits vulnerabilities in NVRs, TP-Link routers
articles.Summary: The campaign started in October and targets multiple network video recorders and TP-Link routers with outdated firmware. The vulnerability exploited to compromise DigiEver NVRs is a remote code execution (RCE) flaw and the hackers are targeting the '/cgi-bin/cgi_mai'
